title: Forgotten people (A)
creator_contributor_role: Mathias, Kenyon and Merton Pictures, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Housing - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Housing - Social aspects
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Housing - Australia
description: Shows the work of the Aborigines Advancement League particularly of Pastor Doug Nicholls and Bill Onus. They visit the settlements of Rumbaland, Robinvale and Dareton, showing the primitive conditions in which the aborigines are forced to live. Government housing is not provided at a sufficient rate. This film stresses the need for more positive action. Sponsored by the Aborigines Advancement League (Victoria) in the wake of the 1967 Referendum, and featuring two of the League's founding members in Nicholls and Onus.
active_carriers_public_types_and_formats: MOV file H264; Digital Access Copy
